alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 2:12PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG DOWNBURST WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN VALENCIA, SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL AND BERNALILLO COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM MDT... At 211 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong downburst winds over Albuquerque, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Corrales, Bernalillo, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Tijeras, Coronado State Monument, Vista Hills, Paradise Hills and Sandia Heights. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 133 and 184. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 208 and 244. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong downburst winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; West Central Highlands
